title: The Chef gets his ways.
content:
The chef decides the dishes,
Not vegan but with blood and fleshes;
Never asked the customer for order,
Did all this in the name of law and order.


His opponent is soft and sensible,
But his ally was dramatic and insensitive.
His actions can divide the world,
In no way anyone could have wanted.

title: Birds,flowers,leaves and a map.
content:
Maps are drawn by humans,
But Borders and boundaries are inhuman;
A bird with wings comprehends human fightings,
And thinks that these are courtship fightings.


Even falcons are fed up with rotting flesh,
War countries are their paradise to rest.
In spring even Flowers stop blooming,
And no leaves fall even with cooling.

title: The Social Media — Symphony
content:
A child in Gaza is viral on Insta,
Sharing stories did not help her improve.
Some bone chilling stories help us remember,
But it is time for justice we all work together.


Who are these people making decisions?
Why are these people making decisions?
If it could ruin their own success,
That is when we the innocent see success.

title: Dictators and elections
content:
Great nations are spoiled by dictators,
Some even elect by mistake themselves a dictator.
Only to protest on the streets in summer,
Instead of expecting a meticulous glimmer.


Great fears lie ahead — choose wise and responsible,
Do not be aligned with religion, race and gender.
By doing so haven’t you made a blunder?

title: Curated | Exclusive | Unscripted
content:
Wine from France and spices from India,
Cars from Germany and furniture from Sweden.
Watches from Switzerland and tulips from 
Netherlands
Dates from Morocco and salmon from Norway.
Oil from the gulf and futures from Japan,
Saffron from Kashmir and whiskey from Nashville.
These are curated and exclusive,
No Tariffs could exclude them.
Curators understand, politicians politicise them.

title: You know who?
content:
Killed thousands in genocide,
Experimented with advancement and homicide.
People struggled only to get a book named his struggles.
Admiration of his art work, cruelty in his language,
To this day makes the language faced by Humour.


Is he reborn? Should we be carful?
Can he be reborn ?? Must we be prudent?
To name him is crime,
Let us not forget his times!

title: Indians and History
content:
History in India is ironical and intense,
Outsiders have us captured in hostile.
We have traded with outsiders with fair sight,
Numerous cultures suppressed
Just to give the sense of nationality.


Imposed nationality is cruel than outsiders atrocity.
Must they pay us the reparations?
Or should we pay them back with good education.
Once and for all independent,
To be held hostage in the independent!

title: Suits and flights
content:
Global news could be more optimistic,
If the Suits decide not to be so narcissistic;
Don’t force the poor to die,
For you to fly high in the sky.

I see shallow waters blood drenched,
In the nations already deserted.
Some play with religion and sentiments,
Others with resources and condiments.

You and I, the common man, shall always die.
Not again, not the way, our ancestors die.

title: My money your majesty
content:
Treaties signed? Not on my behalf.
Agreements made. Not on my behalf.
Conventions met. Not on my behalf.
My kin dies. Of course on your behalf.

Flying back to fairyland. With my money;
Crowned a new age king. With my money.
Trying to solve my problems. With my money.
Merely trying. That is the problem, your majesty in my money.

title: Immigrants and expats
content:
The expats call me, „Immigrant“.
But the birds from abroad in the brutal winter,
Behind my home, back in the tropics,
Had more respect than the refugee who is sick.

Came here for a better life,
Not to steal their wallet and wife.
I contribute enough to sprinkle water in their garden,
Just to be labelled a madman!

title: The Man of War.
content:
From tropical civil wars to temperate regimens,
He who decided to start, never fought.
The real heroes were the sepoys and doctors in scrubs.
What is wrong and what is not—Never decided by men of letters,
But by rulers and his sons—Monarchy is dead,
But democracy feeds on the lies it is fed.
Having wisdom to talk without wisdom to act,
That is how you become the man of war.

title: The Coffee on Sunday
content:
Late mornings with coffee and breakfast in bed,
Reading some books and scrolling the web.
Changing the sheets and cleaning the kitchen,
Tour to the man’s den and cherishing his collectibles.

A hearty lunch and a dinner with wine.
Making love with the dearest wife.
That’s a Sunday for a man in peace.
Not to be bombed—said the man in war.

title: Black and White
content:
Lest assured my cozy winters near fire,
For me today is a day with fear.
Roasted chicken with garlic and honey,
I do not wish to buy bread, it needs money.

Phone calls with family and friends not long met,
Still alive? —I ask when destiny decides to set.
Alternating lines with polarised thoughts,
Not bipolar — but a dialogue between two, one in peace and one in combat.

title: Luxury
content:
Books are not luxury for man in a library,
Photography isn’t a luxury, when you own an imagery.
Words are not luxury, if you own a dictionary.
In the Pursuit of luxury, did we lose humanity?

Away from the city and noise making crowd,
Avoided chemicals, homesteaded alone.
Didn’t trust the government and the subsidy offered.
To my surprise, even my home was bombarded.
